body.p:
To His Excellency
Thomas E Bramlette
Governor of Ky.
New Port Ky
Decr. 13. 1864
Dear Sir
I have the honor of enclosing to you a petition from Frederick Ampher praying a remission of fines assessed against him at the May Term 1864 of the Campbell Circuit Court for selling liquor to minors

Altho. I am well aware of the good policy of the law alleged to be violated yet am satisfied that Ampher is innocent of these charges and if he had have had a fair trial would have proved himself so; This opportunity was denied him made the peculiar circumstances stated on the petition -- The jury and the attorney for the Comth. you will percieve have
joined in the petition -- Hopeing that you will give the case your immediate & favorable consideration I have sir the honor to be
Your Obt. Servt. E. W. Hawkins
